04d181dccf4c11e59fa60242ac110001.title: Ultimate Guide to Gmail
04d181dccf4c11e59fa60242ac110001.priceAdditional:
You can book this course as a group booking for up to 24 people and run it on your own premises at a total cost of £5,130, which could be as little as £213 each.

A group booking for up to 24 people at an external venue will cost £4,432 or as little as £184 each.

VAT is not included.

outcomes.blurb: By the end of the programme you’ll have:
points: understood the impact of providing people with a clear vision of the future during change programmes
explored sources of inspiration and practical techniques to engage and inspire others during change
uncovered the secret behind motivating people through change and the 5 basic social needs we require in order to feel secure in our roles
developed a range of practical tips, tools and advice that can be put into place straightaway
reflected with peers on what change means for you and for your teams
outcomes.warning: Please note that it may take up to 24 hours for your learning record to update following completion of this course.

questions.title: Question one
choices: Like a back of my hand

questions.title: Question two
questions.description: Select which of these you could confidently teach a colleague:
choices: Sending calendars, including shared calendars and create meetings
Attach files or internet links to an email (e.g. documents and websites)
Delete an email and am aware of how to recover deleted emails
Understand follow up flags and importance markers
Can carry out housekeeping and ensure storage limit is not exceeded (e.g. in Outlook)
Use the 'out of office assistant' for the days I'm not working

outcomes.blurb: By the end of the programme you’ll have:
outcomes.warning: Please note that it may take up to 24 hours for your learning record to update following completion of this course.

questions.title: Question one
choices: I'm an email troll and send all kindz of them
It's there, I use it, no biggie

questions.title: Question two
questions.description: Select which of these you could confidently teach a colleague:
choices: Typing and reading typed in stuff
Changing them fonts and using colours
Sending troll emails to w3.org saying what you would change
